skill.name: chronicle-project-tracker
skill.description: Manage Chronicle project development using database-tracked milestones, next steps, and roadmap visualization. Works with MCP tools (fast, structured) or CLI commands (portable). Use when planning features, tracking progress, viewing roadmap, or linking sessions to milestones. Eliminates manual DEVELOPMENT_HISTORY.md updates.
skill.summary: Manage Chronicle project development using database-tracked milestones, next steps, and roadmap visu...
skill.author: ChandlerHardy

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance for using existing Chronicle MCP tools. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no external dependencies.

content.user_title: Track project milestones and roadmap progress
content.value_statement: Managing project development without tracking leads to lost context and unclear priorities. This skill provides structured milestone and roadmap management using Chronicle database tools, enabling progress visualization and session linking.
actual_capabilities: List and filter milestones by status, type, or priority
View project roadmap with completed, in-progress, and planned work
Create and manage next steps linked to milestones
Link development sessions to milestones for context
Generate progress reports with session and commit data
Update milestone status and complete next steps
limitations: Requires Chronicle MCP server or CLI tools to be installed
Cannot create milestones or steps without proper MCP tool access
Does not provide standalone file-based project management

use_cases.title: Track development progress
use_cases.description: View roadmap status, completed milestones, and pending tasks across project timeline

use_cases.title: Link sessions to milestones
use_cases.description: Connect development sessions to active work items for automatic progress tracking

use_cases.title: Generate progress reports
use_cases.description: Create reports showing completed milestones, linked commits, and time spent on work

prompt_templates.title: View roadmap
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the project roadmap. What is in progress and what are the highest priority planned items?

prompt_templates.title: List active milestones
prompt_templates.prompt: What milestones are currently in progress? List each with its priority level.

prompt_templates.title: Check next steps
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the pending next steps? Show priority levels and estimated effort.

prompt_templates.title: Generate report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a progress report for the past week. Include completed milestones and linked sessions.

output_examples.input: What is in progress right now and what should I work on next?
output: - Add project tracking to Chronicle (3 sessions)

best_practices: Link development sessions to milestones as you work for automatic tracking
Break milestones into smaller next steps with priority and effort estimates
Review the roadmap weekly to stay aligned with project priorities
anti_patterns: Creating milestones without breaking them into next steps
Forgetting to link sessions to milestones after completing work
Setting all priorities to the same level, losing meaningful prioritization

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It requires Chronicle MCP server or CLI tools installed.

faq.question: How many milestones can I create?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The database supports unlimited milestones with filtering by status and type.

faq.question: Can I use this without MCP tools?
faq.answer: Yes, you can use CLI commands like chronicle roadmap and chronicle milestones for portable access.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill. It reads data through Chronicle tools but does not modify or transmit data externally.

faq.question: Why is my roadmap empty?
faq.answer: Create milestones using CLI commands first. The roadmap shows existing milestones with their linked sessions and status.

faq.question: How does this differ from other project tools?
faq.answer: This skill connects sessions to milestones automatically using Chronicle session tracking, creating a development history.
